Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the interior bears the remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is grooved, covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394521) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394521)
